bibl.title: Letter from G. A. McDermott to Philip Showalter Hench, March 27, 1946

div1.p: McDermott reaffirms his interest in Hench's planned book on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from G. A. McDermott to Philip Showalter Hench, March 27, 1946
div1.opener:
D. APPLETON-CENTURY COMPANY, INC.
LONDON OFFICE: 34 BEDFORD STREET, STRAND CABLE ADDRESS: HILANDERO
35 West 32nd Street, NEW YORK, 1, N. Y.
March 27, 1946
A C
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This is just a line to tell you that I was delighted
to meet you when I was in Rochester recently. I want to
thank you for a very pleasant visit and to let you know
that I enjoyed every minute of it.

In addition, I must reaffirm to you my interest in
the book that you are planning to write. There is no
doubt in my mind that such a book would prove to be
tremendously interesting to the public and, with the
material you have in hand, you are the man to do it.

I hope that you will keep me advised of your progress
with the manuscript and, if you have no objection, I shall
plan on stopping in to see you whenever I am in Rochester
to keep in touch with you. In the meantime if you happen
to be in New York City any time, I should appreciate it if
you would get in touch with me so that we may have a visit
here.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, G. A. McDermott
D. APPLETON-CENTURY COMPANY, INC. GAMcD:LMC
